summary: Why do you think a lot of people assume that Arya doesn’t want to be a mother? She never said that in the books as far as I can...
question: Why do you think a lot of people assume that Arya doesn’t want to be a mother? She never said that in the books as far as I can remember and she’s a very family-oriented person. It really baffles me that even book reader think that.
answer:
its a cocktail of misinterpretation tbh 

the big issue is just stereotypes. people - whether they pick up the books or not - interpret arya as a “tomboy badass” who only swordfights (even though arya doesnt actually swordfight. like at all). i mean look how common it is in fics/headcanons to portray arya as hating to cook and/or being bad at it. meanwhile in the text shes literally the only pov who spends time in the kitchens cooking. which she enjoys! chopping onions, kneading dough, filleting fish - arya does it all. grrm even said once that arya might think typical domestic duties like making cheese were “fun” (and the books say she could run a household) but this fandom cannot compute arya having “traditionally feminine” attributes. they cannot see arya as a complex girl character with a complex relationship to femininity.

so they project this shallow, one dimensional idea of a “tomboy” who is too “badass” for love onto her. which just denies arya her complexity and her humanity. its worth noting here none of the male characters want children when they’re young; not egg (@10) nor jon (@14). they vehemently deny any interest in marriage/children but we know how that ends. (spoiler: with sex, marriage and babies) also literally most of asoiaf’s “unconventional women” have romantic relationships too 

another big problem is lack of perspective. no, arya doesnt constantly daydream and idealize the notion of marriage/babies like sansa but arya also does not believe she is worthy of love. so why would she? arya doesnt even think her own family would want her back because shes not a proper lady. westeros endorses the idea women have to be paragons of male prescribed femininity to be respected/loved. arya doesnt meet those standards so shes thinks shes unlovable. which is untrue but she doesnt know that yet.

the fandom just doesnt get arya. what she wants above everything is a family. even the wolves in her dreams comfort her after the red wedding. ‘they would never leave her’. she’s a social animal. her core value is her pack. she thrives in a stable community with connections to other people and even animals. she’s deeply loving and protective - that includes with children younger than her which we see with lil brothers and weasel. her interactions with the latter become extremely maternal as arya defends and feeds and holds her. so personally? i could easily see arya as a mother when she’s grown. as her story continues she’ll realize she is loved and not just by her family. lest we forget she has her own custom made love theme with gendry. which pretty much says it all. and theres no reason that she wouldnt decide to make some new starks. the pack survives after all.

summary:
Jon: I know you're not a child anymore but do you really have to marry the assassin ?
Arya: What's wrong with that ? Everyone...
body:
Jon: I know you're not a child anymore but do you really have to marry the assassin ?
Arya: What's wrong with that ? Everyone has thought about killing someone, one way or another, be it your own hand or the hand of God.
Jaqen: Please, it's Jaqen. I like to keep it simple.

body: I don’t get why you guys just cannot seem to like sansa, arya, and daenerys. and then all you do is post about the character that you don’t like instead of spending your time talking about characters you love like and you don’t even have good reasons other than what you’ve read from other antis like??? y’all are boring.

summary: I’m going off on a tangent again but Bran and Arya really get overlooked (not nearly as much as Arya and Robb) think in terms of...
body: I’m going off on a tangent again but Bran and Arya really get overlooked (not nearly as much as Arya and Robb) think in terms of how important they are to each other. Of course Arya and Jon tend to get more of the attention (romantically or platanically) bc it’s just so much content about them. But it just tears me up inside when Bran becomes friends with the Reeds and Jojen is solemn “but Meera reminded Bran of his sister Arya.” Or when he sees one of the children of the forest (who looks nothing like Arya btw) and immediately thinks it’s her, wants it to be her even though he knows there’s no way she could be all the way beyond the wall, if she’s even alive. Honestly it just hurts when he sees Lyanna & Benjen and gets crushed again because this girl looks so much like Arya that the only way he knows it’s not is because the boy isn’t him. Ugh I’ve gone on for too long already and I still haven’t really expressed what I’m even trying to say but Bran and Arya really do love each other and I need them to be together again one day.

Honestly it just hurts when he sees Lyanna & Benjen and gets crushed again because this girl looks so much like Arya that the only way he knows it’s not is because the boy isn’t him. Ugh I’ve gone on for too long already and I still haven’t really expressed what I’m even trying to say but Bran and Arya really do love each other and I need them to be together again one day.

summary: Arya: I want to go home. I want my family. I want to go home. I want to go home. I want my pack.  Arya, that one time: I wonder...
body:
Arya: I want to go home. I want my family. I want to go home. I want to go home. I want my pack. 

Arya, that one time: I wonder what is west of Westeros 

Fandom: Arya wants to travel! She cannot be tied down. She is going to sail West like she has always wanted.
